DE State & Local Officials

Here you can find the information needed in order to reach your local, state, and federal government officials!

  • Dewey Beach - 19971 (Local)
  • State
  • Federal

Mayor Dale Cooke

  • Military veteran and Dewey Beach homeowner for the last 20 years, these are two small items on Mayor Cooke's long list of accomplishments. Mayor Cooke is also a member of many other Dewey Beach committees and the leader of many other groups. His wide range of experience qualifies him for role of mayor well.

Email Me

Commissioner Mike Dunmeyer

  • Commissioner Dunmeyer is currently the owner of two growing small businesses that serve Sussex County and the surrounding area. Prior to that, Mike was the Executive Director for Ocean Champions, the country's only ocean-focused political organization. Mike brings a diverse background to the role of Commissioner.

Governor John Carney

Democrat

  • John Charles Carney Jr. (born May 20, 1956) is the 74th and current Governor of Delaware since January 2017. A member of the Democratic Party, he served as the U.S. Representative for Delaware's at-large congressional district from 2011 to 2017 prior to his governorship. Carney was also the 24th Lieutenant Governor of Delaware from 2001 to 2009 and served as Delaware's Secretary of Finance. He first unsuccessfully sought the Democratic nomination for Governor of Delaware in 2008, losing to Jack Markell. He ran for Governor of Delaware again in 2016 and won to succeed Markell, who was term-limited.

Senator Thomas Carper

Democrat

  • Thomas Richard "Tom" Carper (born January 23, 1947) is the senior United States Senator from Delaware, serving since 2001. A member of the Democratic Party, Carper served in the United States House of Representatives from 1983 to 1993 and was the 71st Governor of Delaware from 1993 to 2001.

Senator Chris Coons

  • Democrat

    Christopher Andrew "Chris" Coons (born September 9, 1963) is the junior United States Senator from Delaware and a member of the Democratic Party. He won a special election in 2010 to succeed Ted Kaufman, who had been appointed to the seat when Joe Biden resigned to become Vice President. Previously, Coons was the county executive of New Castle County. Coons is the 1983 Truman Scholar from Delaware, and the first recipient of the award to serve in the United States Senate.

Representative Lisa Blunt Rochester

  • Democrat

    Lisa Blunt Rochester (born February 10, 1962) is an American politician from the state of Delaware. A member of the Democratic Party, she is a member of the United States House of Representatives, representing Delaware's at-large congressional district. Blunt Rochester was born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania on February 10, 1962.[1] Her family moved to Wilmington, Delaware, in 1969.[2] Her father, Ted Blunt, served on the Wilmington City Council, including as council president.
